intro: Impatiens tapanuliensis, commonly known as the Tapanuli impatiens, is a rare flowering plant native to the highlands of North Sumatra, Indonesia. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has fleshy, alternate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
